{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with fever and chills two hours following an elective cholecystectomy. The most likely cause of her symptoms is an infection. Given that she has a mildly tender abdominal wound without erythema, a urinary tract infection is the most likely cause. The patient had a Foley catheter placed during the procedure, which increases the risk of urinary tract infection. Adverse effects of medication, malignant hyperthermia, and transfusion reactions are less likely in this scenario.", "answer_choice": "C"}
